job_description: Make a DifferenceThis is an opportunity to join EnerNOC’s Vancouver development team located in downtown Vancouver.  We build industry-leading web-based clean tech software solutions that help businesses reduce energy consumption through demand response and improved engagement with their energy utility.Join a Leading-Edge R&D TeamWe are looking for developers to work on the next generation of energy analytics; to automate the understanding and prediction of a building’s energy behavior.  You will have the opportunity to utilize state of the art statistical, data mining, visualization, and machine learning algorithms in our scalable and secure cloud-based architecture.In this position you are expected to utilize software development best practices to ensure solutions are deployed to our customers.Responsibilities• Prototyping, design, and software development of core mathematical, data mining, visualization, and machine learning algorithms.• Data mining and analysis of our extensive database of energy data from buildings worldwide.
job_requirements: Required Qualifications:• Enrolled in a quantitative program such as Operations Research, Computer Science, Statistics, or Engineering.• Experience developing in R, Python, Clojure, Matlab or a similar tool.• Knowledge of analytic techniques and machine learning methods is highly desired.• Experience with data mining and visualization of large datasets is highly desired.• Strong programming skills in an object-oriented programming language or a functional programming language.• Energy domain expertise is highly desired; a passion for the energy domain is essential.• Familiarity with at least one Unix scripting language.• Strong verbal and written communication skills.• Team player who can work with minimal supervision.• A working knowledge of web development and automated test development is highly desired.Open To All Majors:No
